I am working with NEAT to try to get a common play
space to use, but that is it right now.
 I hope to be able to use it more soon.
Hey guys I think I may have found something for us.
I will let you all know soon .
Thanks
Rog


--- Chris Christenson <cc57@...> wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> I am currently working with NEAT.  I am trying to
> alter the windows version
> to do some color recognition.  Primarily, my goal is
> to be able to use the
> algorithm.  After I feel comfortable with the code,
> I will apply it to board
> games.  I am hoping to create a neural network that
> will act as a heuristic
> function.
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> -Chris Christenson (afro)
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Derek James [mailto:blue5432@...] 
> Sent: Wednesday, November 12, 2003 11:43 PM
> To: neat@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [neat] Roll Call
> 
> Hey all,
> 
> People have been steadily trickling in to the group
> for the past few weeks, so I just wanted to
> officially
> welcome those who've recently joined.
> 
> I'm wondering who is now actively working with NEAT,
> or a close variant, and then, if you're not
> currently,
> who might be interested in working with NEAT in the
> future.
> 
> For those who haven't scoured the archives yet, I'm
> Derek James, the moderator of the group.  Philip
> Tucker (also on this list) and I are working on a
> Java
> implementation of NEAT that we hope to opensource in
> the near future.  We're primarily interested in
> board
> game domains, specifically the Gomoku/Renju/Go class
> of games, but also to a lesser degree, other game
> domains and real-time robot control.
> 
> Anyway, chime in if you like, and let us know what
> you're up to, or what you're thinking about.
> 
> Best,
> Derek James
>
